note: The Athenian Amnesty and Reconstructing the Law (Oxford University Press, 2013).
title: Edwin Carawan is Professor of Classical Languages at Missouri State University. His research focuses on law and rhetoric in ancient Greece. He is the author of Rhetoric and the Law of Draco
and editor of The Attic Orators
For 2010–11, he received a fellowship from the National Endowment for the Humanities for a recent study of the settlement of civil conflict at Athens

Gellar-Goad is Assistant Professor of Classical Languages at Wake Forest University. He has published articles on sacrifice and ritual imagery in Plautus and Terence and in 2012 served as Composer in Residence for a National Endowment for the Humanities Institute, “The Performance of Roman Comedy
